HDAC inhibitors have been extensively studied in the treatment of tumour and other epigenetic disorders
20 . According to the chemical structure, HDACIs are divided into groups, including hydroxamic acids, aminobenzamides, cyclic peptides, carboxylic acids, and hybrid molecules
4 . Suberoylanilide hydroxamic acid (SAHA)
22 and FK228
23 have been approved by US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for the treatment of refractory cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL). PDX101
24 and LBH589
25 have been approved for the treatment of peripheral T-cell lymphoma (PTCL) and multiple myeloma, respectively. Chidamide
26 is a benzamide HDACI approved by Chinese Food and Drug Administration (CFDA) for the treatment of relapsed or refractory PTCL.
